title: Science Lab Safety, Hazard Symbols, and Apparatus
subject: Science

questions.question: What does this symbol mean? (Image description: flame)
questions.explanation: Flame symbol indicates flammable substances that can catch fire easily.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT allowed in the science lab?
questions.explanation: Eating and drinking are prohibited to avoid contamination and ingestion of chemicals.

questions.question: What is the main use of a boiling tube compared to a test tube?
questions.explanation: Boiling tubes are larger and thicker, suitable for heating liquids; test tubes are for small-scale reactions.

questions.question: Which apparatus is placed between the tripod stand and the beaker when heating?
questions.explanation: Wire gauze spreads heat evenly and supports the beaker on a tripod.

questions.question: Before lighting a Bunsen burner, you should always:
options: Open the air hole fully and light immediately
Close the gas tap and then open it
Close the air hole and light the match first
questions.explanation: For a safety flame, close the air hole before lighting to produce a yellow, visible flame.

questions.question: What does this symbol mean? (Image description: skull and crossbones)
questions.explanation: Skull and crossbones indicates toxic substances that can cause poisoning or death.

questions.question: When heating a test tube, you should point the mouth:
options: Towards your face for closer observation
questions.explanation: Always point the test tube away to avoid injury from splashes or eruptions.

questions.question: Which piece of equipment is used to hold a test tube while heating?
questions.explanation: A test tube holder keeps your hands safe from heat when heating a test tube.

questions.question: What should you do if you spill a chemical on your skin?
options: Ignore it if it's a small amount
Wash with plenty of water and inform teacher
questions.explanation: Immediately rinse with running water for several minutes and report to the teacher.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a heatproof mat?
options: To protect the bench from heat damage
questions.explanation: Heatproof mats protect lab surfaces from hot equipment.

questions.question: Which symbol means 'corrosive'?
options: Test tube pouring liquid onto a hand and surface
questions.explanation: Corrosive symbol shows liquid damaging a hand and materialâ€”means it can destroy living tissue and materials.

questions.question: When should you wear safety goggles in the lab?
options: Only if the teacher is watching
questions.explanation: Safety goggles should be worn throughout the experiment to protect eyes from splashes, fumes, or flying particles.

questions.question: What is the correct order of steps when lighting a Bunsen burner?
options: Open gas tap, light match, adjust air hole
Close air hole, light match, open gas tap, adjust flame
Open air hole fully, open gas tap, light immediately
Light match first, then open gas tap
questions.explanation: Close air hole, light match, open gas tap gently, then adjust air hole for desired flame.

questions.question: Which hazard symbol indicates a substance that may cause skin irritation?
questions.explanation: Exclamation mark symbol indicates irritant or harmful substances that can cause skin/eye irritation.

questions.question: What should you do at the end of every lab session?
options: Leave all equipment out for the next class
Dispose of solids in the sink
questions.explanation: Always wash hands after handling chemicals or lab equipment to prevent contamination.
